title: Police confirm body found in derelict building is missing girl Kiana Patton
text:
Get the biggest daily news stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

Police have confirmed the body of a 16-year-old girl found in Pembroke Dock has been formally identified as missing teenager Kianna Patton.

The body was discovered at a derelict building around 4.45pm on Thursday, October 24 less than a mile from her home.

The teenager was last seen on Wednesday, October 23 at around 3pm in Pembroke Dock.

Dyfed-Powys police then launched a huge search and a body was found the next day, reports WalesOnline.

Kianna's dad, Kianna's dad, Pilgrim, who lives in Germany, told The Sun: "Police confirmed to me that my daughter’s body was found today.

(Image: Getty Images/iStockphoto)

"She was only 16 years old. I have no answers as to why. I will never have answers. I don’t think any of us will."

A spokesperson for the force said: "Dyfed-Powys Police can confirm that formal identification has taken place and the body discovered in Pembroke Dock on October 24 is that of 16-year-old Kianna Patton."

Kianna's next of kin and the HM coroner have been informed.

Tributes have flooded in across social media after the devastating news.

Sharon Crockford said: "Kianna princess you were loved so much such a beautiful little girl turned in to a beautiful young lady."

Another Caroline Lee wrote "So so sad. I know there was every police available police officer in Pembrokeshire looking for this little girl today."
description: The body of a girl was discovered in Pembroke Dock, in Pembrokeshire, Wales, last week
